duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform administration and analysis of WGU’s Compensation programs and work in conjunction with Business leaders and other members of People & Talent to administer, recommend and review compensation policies, procedures & programs at WGU.
Serve as a primary compensation contact for assigned client groups and partner with Talent & Hiring leaders to develop compensation offers.

Perform Job description reviews including Market reviews, Job creation process, and recommend, conduct, and participate in salary surveys in order to understand competitive compensation levels in the organization.

Communicate & coach business leaders and employees on compensation processes and policies, administer Merit, Annual & Market adjustments, and assure through audits, analysis and reports, that all organization compensation programs are consistently administered in compliance with company policies and government regulations.

Work on core compensation projects, conduct ad-hoc analysis on compensation policies, procedures and programs and make recommendations based on Market competitiveness and Total Rewards Philosophy, and perform other duties as required.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree, At least 5 years of Compensation specific experience including experience building Market composites and performing Market reviews. Detail oriented, ability to influence in a professional manner.
